value.title: Surrey: AI to help turn dog pics into 3D models
value.excerpt: Photographs of dogs could be used to help generate 3D models more accurately, a study has revealed. Researchers at the University of Surrey taught an artificial intelligence (AI) system to predict the 3D pose from a 2D image of a dog. A myriad of virtual dogs were created using the video game Grand Theft Auto.

value.title: Driving with Artificial Intelligence (AI) to Survive

value.title: Is AI More Creative Than Humans?
value.excerpt: A new study compared human and AI performance on various creative tasks. It found AI excelled in originality and elaboration, sparking debate about the "soul” of AI creativity. The study used objective scoring to evaluate creativity, avoiding human rating biases. Suggests a collaborative future where AI enhances human creativity.

value.title: Facial recognition tech is probably coming to a lot more vending machines
value.excerpt: Chris Russell of the Oxford Internet Institute says facial recognition technology is cheap, easy to install and is going to become increasingly common.

value.title: Dysolve: Using AI To Beat Dyslexia Through Generative Games
value.excerpt: Dysolve is the first AI computer program for dyslexia that does not use preset testing kits but instead uses AI to diagnore and treat using dynamically generated games.
